comments.author: rfr
comments.content: Looks delicious!  I will try it!

comments.author: Corinne
comments.content:
This looks fabulous,and so simple!I especially love that it's oil-free! :)
Corinne

comments.author: Suzy
comments.content: That's just the sort of thing I need and, as luck would have it, I am just eating grilled mango on toast (topped with a little cream cheese and have half a mango over.  Roll on dinner time!

comments.author: zenchef
comments.content:
This is a beautiful site that you've got, Michael. I'll make sure to check it out often.
And this salad is just perfect. The flavor combination is one of my favorites. Very nice.

comments.author: Charles G. Thompson
comments.content: Mango, cucumbers and chili sauce sounds like the perfect combination.  Looking forward to making this!

comments.author: Diana @ frontyardfoodie
comments.content: Oh yummy! Mangoes and cucumbers are two of my favorite foods but I would have never thought to put them together!

comments.author: pb
comments.content: wow.. simple but exotic..now to get some mangoes...

comments.author: Lael Hazan @educatedpalate
comments.content: Clever flavor combo... Now I'm sitting under my mango tree "willing" it to ripen.... I don't have the patience.... I may have to go to the store!

comments.author: Alessandra
comments.content: Here in New Zealand mangos are so expensive that when I get my hands on one I just eat it as it is! I have another giveaway on my blog, in case you are interested :-) http://alessandrazecchini.blogspot.com/2011/02/saint-valentines-day-heart-sushi-and.html good luck!

comments.author: Sean
comments.content: Mmmm.. delicious Mango salad! I added you to my blog roll. http://easyvegetarianrecipes.topwebreview.com

comments.author: lillyonthevalley
comments.content: interesting how will be cucumber and mango tasted together

comments.author: John
comments.content:
This (along with the truffled-sheeps-lik-cheese crostini, and some baked acorn squash) was tonight's dinner at our place. Everyone loved it. The use of mint is inspired. And making mango hedgehogs was really fun. This is one of those rare dishes where it looks as good when *I* make it as when the Michael does. :)

One small quibble: I found the English cuke surprisingly flavorless (maybe it's just the season...dunno). I think I'd prefer an american cuke's flavor here.

comments.author: emily
comments.content: so very tasty!  i made this for dinner (cut the cucumber in thick matchsticks) along with some pan fried tofu marinated in the same dressing (plus a bit of tamari, ginger, and sesame oil) all on top of some rice vermicelli and shredded lettuce and some chopped salty peanuts over everything.  sort of a fast viet bun type dish that is excellent for a weeknight.  thanks for the inspiration!

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Your version sounds great! I've got another version of bun here if you are interested: https://herbivoracious.com//2009/10/vietnamese-vermicelli-bun-with-ginger-grapefruit-sauce-recipe.html . Thanks, Michael

comments.author: John
comments.content: Made this again last night, with the addition of a very ripe canteloupe. It changes the nature of the disk a bit, but worked really well.

comments.author: Susan
comments.content: Absolutely delicious!  Refreshing and satisfying. I thought I had a lemon cucumber, which turned out to be a Korean melon, but that was a fine bridge between the mango and cucumber.  Outstanding!

comments.author: Mom Amelia
comments.content: Hi Michael, What a great idea to use sweet chili sauce as the dressing for a mango cucumber salad. Thanks! I usually use Persian cucumbers instead of the English cucumber. Do you think one is better than the other?

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: I love a good, flavorful Persian cuke -- totally appropriate in this dish!
